Key Match Events: Sikander Raza did major damage to Pakistan's batting line-up and Brad Evans held his nerve to defend 11 runs in the final over.
Zimbabwe stunned Pakistan after clinching a final over thriller.
Babar Azam's Pakistan failed to chase down 131 runs from 20 overs.
Brad Evans bowled the final over and defended 11 runs, securing a 1-run victory for Zimbabwe.
Sikandar Raza was named Player of the Match for his exceptional performance.
Mohammad Nawaz played well down the order but could not secure the win for Pakistan.
Zimbabwe's bowlers, including Evans, Blessing Muzarabani, and Richard Ngarava, were brilliant with the new ball.
Raza was exceptional in the middle overs, taking crucial wickets.
Zimbabwe celebrated a historic win with their fans.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Ervine, the skipper of Zimbabwe, said it was a special win and applauded the performance of Raza.
Babar Azam, the captain of Pakistan, expressed disappointment and mentioned they were not up to the mark with the bat.
Sikandar Raza expressed pride in his team's performance and thanked Ricky Ponting for a motivational clip he received.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a low-scoring thriller.
Pakistan's bowlers, including Wasim, Rauf, and Shadab, kept Zimbabwe to a low score.
Zimbabwe fought till the last ball and won the game by the slightest of margins.
The pitch conditions in Perth played a significant role in the match outcome.
